app.name: VisiData
app.one_liner: A terminal spreadsheet multitool for discovering and arranging data

screens.name: Main Sheet View
screens.purpose: Display and interact with loaded tabular data, allowing sorting, filtering, column operations, and navigation.
primary_actions: Invoke commands via palette or keystrokes

rust_commands.name: addcol_aggregate
rust_commands.purpose: Add a new column showing aggregated values (e.g., sum, average) of a selected numeric column.

rust_commands.name: move_to_cell_below
rust_commands.purpose: Move cursor to the cell directly below during editing without using Shift+Down.

rust_commands.name: save_item
rust_commands.purpose: Persist current sheet or selection to a file in a supported format (e.g., CSV, JSON, SQLite).

mvp_plan: week 1: Add command palette with fuzzy search
week 1: Build basic navigation and editing commands
week 1: Implement core sheet loading for CSV/TSV
week 1: Support saving sheets to disk
acceptance_tests: Saving a modified sheet preserves data types and structure in the target format.
User can load a CSV file and immediately view its contents in a scrollable grid.
User can open the command palette, type 'aggregate', and add a sum column for a numeric field.
When viewing a sheet, numerical column summaries (sum, avg) appear in the sidebar if enabled.
